gmit

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gmit.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Acts as a container for the Strings created from the input file or URL and provides methods for searching, deleting and replacing Strings.
    Version:
    1.0 Jan 7 2014
    Author:
    Malcolm O'Beirn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileManager() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int containerSize()
      Gets the total size of the container.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String word)
      Checks if the search word is contained within the results.
      int count()
      Gets the number of words in the container, not the container size!
      int countDistinct()
      Gets the number of distinct words in the container
      int countOccurrences(java.lang.String searchWord)
      Gets the number of words in the container matching the search word
      void delete(java.lang.String searchWord, boolean deleteIsWord)
      Deletes a specified word or a word at a specified index
      void getAllIndices(java.lang.String searchWord)
      Gets all indexes of the search word.
      int getFirstIndex(java.lang.String word)
      Gets the first index position of the search word.
      int getLastIndex(java.lang.String word)
      Gets the first index position of the search word.
      void listContents(boolean isAllContents)
      Lists all words or only unique words
      void optimise()
      Reduces container size to exact number of words.
      void parse(java.lang.String file)
      This takes in new local files or URLs, removes all non letter characters and splits the resulting String into a container of words
      void parseHtml(java.lang.String html)
      This takes in new local html files or URLs, removes all html formatting, removes all non letter characters and splits the resulting String into a container of words
      void replace(java.lang.String searchWord, java.lang.String replaceWord, boolean searchIsWord)
      Replaces a specified word or a word at a specified index

           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This takes in new local files or URLs, removes all non letter characters and splits the resulting String into a container of words

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseHtml

        public void parseHtml(java.lang.String html)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This takes in new local html files or URLs, removes all html formatting, removes all non letter characters and splits the resulting String into a container of words
        Parameters:
        html - A html file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String word)
        Checks if the search word is contained within the results.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to be searched for.
        Returns:
        True if found, False if not found.

        public int getFirstIndex(java.lang.String word)
        Gets the first index position of the search word.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to be searched for.
        Returns:
        Index position of first occurrence of search word.

      • getLastIndex

        public int getLastIndex(java.lang.String word)
        Gets the first index position of the search word.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to be searched for.
        Returns:
        Index position of last occurrence of search word. Returns -1 if word not found.

        The number of words in the container.

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String searchWord,
          boolean deleteIsWord)
        Deletes a specified word or a word at a specified index
        Parameters:
        searchWord - The word to be deleted or the index number
        deleteIsWord - True if it is a word to be deleted, false if it is an index

      • replace

        public void replace(java.lang.String searchWord,
           java.lang.String replaceWord,
           boolean searchIsWord)
        Replaces a specified word or a word at a specified index
        Parameters:
        searchWord - The word to be replaced or the index number
        replaceWord - the replacement word.
        searchIsWord - True if it is a word to be replaced, false if it is an index
